official-title.#text:
To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to
		  designate segments of the mainstem of the Nashua River and its tributaries in
		  the Commonwealth of Massachusetts for study for potential addition to the
		  National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other
		  purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text:
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of
			 the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be
			 printed

action-instruction.#text:
Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert
			 the part printed in italic

For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as
			 introduced on January 23, 2013

action-desc.#text:
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of
		  the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be
		  printed

short-title.#text:
Nashua River Wild and Scenic River
			 Study Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5(a) of the Wild
			 and Scenic Rivers Act

text.#text:
The approximately 19-mile segment of the
				mainstem of the Nashua River from the confluence of the North and South Nashua
				Rivers in Lancaster, Massachusetts, north to the Massachusetts/New Hampshire
				State line, except the approximately 4.8-mile segment of the mainstem of the
				Nashua River from the Route 119 bridge in Groton, Massachusetts, downstream to
				its confluence with the Nissitissit River in Pepperell, Massachusetts.

The 10-mile segment of
				the Squannacook River from its headwaters at Ash Swamp downstream to its
				confluence with the Nashua River in Shirley/Ayer, Massachusetts.

The 3.5-mile segment of
				the Nissitissit River from the Massachusetts/New Hampshire State line
				downstream to its confluence with the Nashua River in Pepperell,
				Massachusetts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5(b) of the
			 Wild and Scenic Rivers Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall complete the study of the Nashua River in
				Massachusetts and New Hampshire, as described in

, and
				submit a report describing the results of that study to the

Committee on

				Senate
